title: 'I hope he keeps it up': Hear Fauci's praise for Trump
description: In an interview on ABC's "This Week," Dr. Anthony Fauci praised Donald Trump for promoting vaccines and expressed dismay over a crowd booing the former president when he announced that he'd received his Covid-19 booster shot.

title: On GPS: How will 2021 go down in history?
description: Historians Doris Kearns Goodwin and Jon Meacham join Fareed to reflect on 2021 and how it compares to decades past.

title: Snow will impede post-Christmas travel across parts of United States
description: Snow and cold continue to blanket the western and northern United States, setting up hazardous post-Christmas travel conditions Sunday and into the final week of 2021.

title: Windsor Castle intruder with crossbow detained under Mental Health Act, police say
description: An armed 19-year-old man arrested Saturday morning for trespassing at Windsor Castle, where Queen Elizabeth II is staying for Christmas, has been detained by police under the Mental Health Act, London's Metropolitan Police said Sunday.

title: How to limit the heightened risk of infection during travel, according to an expert
description: For Americans traveling after Christmas and New Year's, getting their Covid-19 vaccinations or booster doses as soon as possible is critical to safely avoid serious illness, one health expert told CNN Saturday.

title: Cruises are once again facing disruption because of Covid-19
description: At least four ocean cruise ships were turned away from ports of call or were prohibited from letting passengers disembark in the Americas this week because of Covid-19 cases aboard.

title: Dad, sons and dogs die in fire likely caused by Christmas tree or electrical issues
description: A father and his two school-aged sons died on Christmas Day when their house caught fire, likely due to a combination of electrical issues and a dry Christmas tree, according to Quakertown, Pennsylvania, Fire Marshal Doug Wilhelm.

title: Desmond Tutu, anti-apartheid leader and voice of justice, has died
description: Archbishop Desmond Tutu, the Nobel Peace Prize-winning Anglican cleric whose good humor, inspiring message and conscientious work for civil and human rights made him a revered leader during the struggle to end apartheid in his native South Africa, has died. He was 90.

title: 'Emily in Paris' Season 2 is your winter travel escape, from St-Tropez to Versailles
description: Virtual travel might be the safest way to travel at the moment.

title: The world's most indebted property developer reports progress completing homes
description: China Evergrande Group said on Sunday it had made initial progress in resuming construction work with its chairman vowing to deliver 39,000 units of properties in December, compared with fewer than 10,000 in each of the previous three months.

title: The charges against Ghislaine Maxwell in her federal sex trafficking trial, explained
description: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with six counts in her federal trial in New York related to what prosecutors say are her efforts to groom and traffic underage girls to be sexually abused by her close companion Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Thirty years after the Soviet Union collapsed, Putin exploits nostalgia for the old regime
description: When the Soviet Union finally fell, it was in a mundane way, as if it had clocked off from a normal day's work.

title: The bipartisan friendship that could overcome 'toxic' year in Washington
description: Two Michigan lawmakers from opposite sides of the aisle came together to urge the importance of unity and kindness after a "toxic" year in Washington and across the country.

title: The next Tesla is proving hard to find
description: Finding the next Tesla among electric vehicle stocks is proving to be difficult.

title: Biden's struggles shouldn't eclipse GOP's year of dangerous falsehoods
description: America's running political conversation defaults to the sitting president. Today, Joe Biden's legislative struggles, pandemic management and weak approval rating drown out most everything else.

title: Skier dies after being 'fully buried' in a Colorado avalanche
description: A backcountry skier near Cameron Pass in Colorado's Rocky Mountains died Christmas Eve after being "fully buried" in an avalanche, officials said.

title: Palestinian embroidery added to UNESCO list of cultural heritages
description: Bethlehem is where the Christmas story began. The Covid-19 pandemic has hurt the city's producers of traditional dresses, but amid the doom and gloom, Palestinian embroidery received an international seal of approval from UNESCO. CNN's Andrew Carey reports.

title: After five seasons, 'Insecure' leaves behind a long-lasting legacy
description: For the last five years, many Sunday scaries have been staved off by one thing: "Insecure."

title: The seven principles of Kwanzaa
description: Christmas might be over, but Kwanzaa is just getting started.

title: Olivia Munn and John Mulaney have shared a photo of their new baby
description: It's a Christmas Eve gift! Actress Olivia Munn and comedian John Mulaney have shared the first glimpse of their baby, who is now 1 month old.

title: Desmond Tutu: A life in pictures
description: Desmond Tutu, the first Black archbishop of Cape Town, South Africa, and who received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1984 for his efforts to end apartheid, has died at the age of 90.

title: As the Taliban swept into Kabul, one woman's best friend escaped. They shared their anguish on WhatsApp
On 40th anniversary, Citymeals on Wheels provides 20K 'festive meals' to elderly New Yorkers
description: Citymeals on Wheels, a New York City-based non-profit that provides meals to elderly New Yorkers, provided 20,000-holiday meals to older city residents on Christmas morning with the help of 300 volunteers, a news release from the organization says. The achievement comes as the non-profit celebrates its 40th Christmas in operation.

title: Suicide bomber kills at least five at east Congo restaurant
description: A suicide bomber struck a restaurant in the Democratic Republic of Congo's eastern city of Beni on Saturday, killing at least five people as well as himself, officials said.

title: More than 30 reported killed, Save the Children staff missing, in Myanmar attack
description: At least 30 people, including women and children, were killed in the eastern Myanmar state of Kayah on Friday, according to the Karenni Human Rights Group, with two members of international humanitarian group Save the Children still missing.

title: More than 30 reported killed in Myanmar Christmas Day attack
description: At least 30 people, including women and children, were killed in the eastern Myanmar state of Kayah, according to the Karenni Human Rights Group, with two members of international humanitarian group Save the Children still missing.
